title: Sine and Cosine Graphs - displacement from axis

content.question:
The angle in standard position is labeled theta.

The initial ray is on the positive x axis, and the terminal ray passes through a point on the circle in the second quadrant labeled P.

​The figure shows a terminal ray of an angle of measure <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in standard position intersecting the unit circle at point <math alttext="P"><semantics><mi>P</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> in the <math alttext="x y"><semantics><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-plane. As <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> increases from <math alttext="0"><semantics><mn>0</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> to <math alttext="2 pi"><semantics><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>π</mi></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>, which of the following gives the graph of the displacement of <math alttext="P"><semantics><mi>P</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> from the <math alttext="x"><semantics><mi>x</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-axis as a function of <math alttext="theta"><semantics><mi>θ</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> ?

choices.label:
All coordinates are approximate. Moving from left to right:

The curve begins at point (0 comma 0).

The curve trends up gradually to reach a maximum point at (pi over 2 comma 1).

At point (pi over 2 comma 1), the curve trends down gradually, through the x axis at (pi comma 0), and reaches a minimum point at (3 pi over 2 comma negative 1).

At point (3 pi over 2 comma negative 1), the curve trends up gradually to the right and ends at point (2 pi comma 0).
